r.s: Resolver library used to communicate with a DNS server.
r.d: A resolver library used to communicate with a name server to perform DNS queries, zone transfers, dynamic DNS updates, etc. Creates an object hierarchy from a DNS server response, which allows you to view all of the information given by the DNS server. It bypasses the system resolver library and communicates directly with the server.
r.n: QA release Bug #9168 Make mhash dependency optional Bug #9268 send_tcp method doesn't receive all packets Bug #10805 Invalid num values on x86_64 AMD Bug #12487 Spurious "Fatal error: Class 'Net_DNS_RR' not found" Bug #12573 incorrect license in package.xml bugfixes and transition to package2.xml
